title: Adjustment Codes â€” adjustment_codes
text: Claim Adjustment Reason Codes: X12 External Code Source 139 codes describe claim service line paid differently billed generally assign responsibility adjustment amounts. Claim Adjustment Group Codes internal X12 standard. format always two alpha characters: CO: Contractual Obligations CR: Corrections Reversals OA: Adjustments PI: Payer Initiated Reductions PR: Patient Responsibility Remittance Advice Remark Codes: X12 External Code Source 411 Remittance Advice Remark Codes (RARCs) used provide additional explanation adjustment already described Claim Adjustment Reason Code (CARC) convey information remittance processing. two types RARCs: Supplemental Informational: majority RARCs supplemental , , generally referred RARCs without distinction. Supplemental RARCs provide additional explanation adjustment already described CARC. second type informational; prefaced Alert: referred Alerts. used convey information remittance processing never related specific adjustment CARC.

title: Calculate Physician Fee Schedule Payment Amounts â€” calculate_amounts
text: ((wRVU x wGPCI) + (pRVU x pGPCI) + (mRVU x mGPCI)) x Conversion Factor

title: Calculate Physician Fee Schedule Payment Amounts â€” calculate_amounts
code: calculate_amounts(wrvu, fprvu, nprvu, mrvu, wgpci, pgpci, mgpci, cf = 32.7442)

title: Calculate Physician Fee Schedule Payment Amounts â€” calculate_amounts
text: wrvu Work RVU fprvu Facility Practice Expense RVU nprvu Non-Facility Practice Expense RVU mrvu Malpractice RVU wgpci Work GPCI pgpci Practice Expense GPCI mgpci Malpractice GPCI cf Conversion Factor, default 32.7442

title: Restructured BETOS Classification for HCPCS â€” rbcs
text: Restructured BETOS Classification System (RBCS) taxonomy allows researchers group Medicare Part B healthcare service codes clinically meaningful categories subcategories. Based original Berenson-Eggers Type Service (BETOS) classification created 1980s, includes notable updates Part B non-physician services undergoes annual updates technical expert panel researchers clinicians. general framework grouping service codes new RBCS taxonomy largely follows structure BETOS. Like BETOS, RBCS groups HCPCS codes categories, subcategories, families â€“ categories aggregate level families granular level. Medicare Part B service codes, including non-physician services, assigned 6-character RBCS taxonomy code.
